resources.string: Sorry, the package installer is not found.

"APK Batch Renamer is activated now!
How to do? Select target APKs in any file explorer and share/send them to APK Batch Renamer."

"APK Checker grows with users' help.
Thank > @balzac, etc. for helping design the new icon. > @mooooo, @以Porsche之名, @illsr, etc. for helping translate into Traditional Chinese. > @萌萌的小雅酱, etc. for helping translate into Japanese. > @maksnogin, etc. for helping translate into Russian. > @luchun0112, etc. for feeding back and suggesting.
APK Checker includes libraries licensed under the Apache Software License 2.0. > Modified version of zip4j_v1.3.2"
Notice that, the application icon WILL NOT appear in the launcher.
"An activity represents a single screen with a user interface. It is one of the four essential app components for an Android app. (The green is activity which is available for use by other apps.)"
Line 1 is name according to current language, and line 2 is in English (if exists).
The end of the validity period of the certificate.
It shows the following items: the name of the algorithm for the certificate signature, the certificates version, hash value of MD5, hash value of SHA1 and hash value of SHA256.
The start of the validity period of the certificate.
"The date when the application package was created. Notice that, it's not always accurate."
"The name of the .apk file. (It's a duplication if red. Because the raw APK is not accessible.)"
"The real full path of the .apk file. (It's a duplication if red. Because the raw APK is not accessible.)"
The time at which the app was first installed.
The size should be 48*48dp according to official documents.
"It shows the application that installed this package. This identifies which market the package came from, such as Google Play Store."
The time at which the app was last updated.
"A front-door activity in a package. If the value were empty, there would be no the application's icon in \"Launcher\"."
What you see is raw image without scaling.

"An integer designating the minimum API Level required for the application to run. The Android system will prevent the user from installing the application if the system's API Level is lower than the value specified in this attribute."
"A full Java-language-style package name for the application. The name should be unique. Once an application published, the package name could not be changed."
Declares a security permission that can be used to limit access to specific components or features of this or other applications.
"A content provider manages a shared set of app data. It is one of the four essential app components for an Android app. (The green is content provider which is available for use by other apps.)"

"A broadcast receiver is a component that responds to system-wide broadcast announcements. Many broadcasts originate from the system. It is one of the four essential app components for an Android app. (The green is receiver which is available for use by other apps.)"

"Android is a privilege-separated operating system, and additional finer-grained security features are provided through a \"permission\" mechanism that enforces restrictions on the specific operations that a particular process can perform. \"Requested permissions\" lists all permissions this application requested. (The red is permission which is dangerous defined in API 23. Dangerous permissions cover areas where the app wants data or resources that involve the user's private information, or could potentially affect the user's stored data or the operation of other apps.)"

"A service is a component that runs in the background to perform long-running operations or to perform work for remote processes. A service does not provide a user interface. It is one of the four essential app components for an Android app. (The green is service which is available for use by other apps.)"

"A signing certificate associated with the application package. All APKs (.apk files) must be signed with a certificate whose private key is held by their developer. This certificate identifies the author of the application. \"Signatures\" shows the following items: CN(first and last name), OU(organizational unit), O(organization), L(city or locality), ST(state or province) and C(country code). (Red if informal.)"
"ABIs supported by this application. Notice that, it's not always correct."
An integer designating the API Level that the application targets.
"An internal version number. This number is used only to determine whether one version is more recent than another, with higher numbers indicating more recent versions."
The version number shown to users.
No need, you are already a developer.
It will take effect NEXT TIME.
"The file name has been renamed to %s"
APK Checker needs this permission to read APKs.
The launcher icon has been saved to Picture Directory.
